page.title: 13Burringham School.
page.content: Burringham school has been open for 114 years. There are four classrooms. Most of the classrooms are very small. The way it was built was very strange because half was made of brick and the other half was made of limestone. The limestone had very interesting fossils in it. The school field is just an ordinary field with an oak tree in it. The school was extended in 1971 which made more room for classrooms. The field is 60 metres long. The children have to go through the car park to get to the pavement. Also there is no barrier to stop them running on to the road.
